newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.African wool prices lower at latest auction.
newsitem.headline: S.African wool prices lower at latest auction.

text.p: South African wool prices were lower at the latest weekly auction, the Wool Board said.
It said 4,634 bales were offered at this week's sale, of which 93.5 percent was sold.

Price quotes for long Merino fleeces of 20 micron rose 1.1 percent, 21 micron fell 0.6 percent, 22 micron rose 1.4 percent, 23 micron fell 2.8 percent, 24 micron fell 2.5 percent and 25 micron fell 2.1 percent.
Prices for Merino bellies fell 2.2 percent, Merino lambs fell 4.9 percent and Merino locks fell 3.3 percent.
The offering included 1,774 bales of other White Wools, 1,376 bales of Ciskei/Transkei, 2,121 bales of Lesotho and 1,132 bales of coarse and coloured.
Of the 170 bales of 20 micron offered, 87.7 percent was sold.
Of the 418 bales of 21 micron offered, 89.5 percent was sold. Of the 565 bales of 22 micron offered, 98.1 percent was sold.
Of the 483 bales of 23 micron offered, 98.8 percent was sold and of 257 bales of 24 micron offered, 99.2 percent was sold and of the 65 bales of 25 micron offered, one hundred percent was sold.
The next sale will take place on May 21, when about 9,500 bales will be on offer.
